text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Head of Tallinn municipal services was dismissed for inadequate snow clearing operation after heavy snowfall paralysed traffic in the city over the weekend.
- The court case of President Lennart Meri over the land plot at his Paslepa official residence was postponed as the other party could not attend for health grounds.
- A four-member delegation of the Russian State Duma is on a visit to Estonia on December 17-18.
- The parliament debated the draft law on the protection of personal data, calling for the Interior ministry to form a corresponding department by January 1.
- Estonian officials expect Estonia to join the World Trade Organisation in 1997.
